Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you stands a sharply dressed man, adorned in gold-trimmed silks and a sable surcoat. His eyes weigh you as swiftly as any set of merchant's scales.

“Welcome to Sunreach, jewel of the southern coast. I am Darius Veynar, Merchant Prince and head of the Council of Five Houses.
In these days of shadows and shifting fortunes, I am always in need of capable hands—provided they know the value of discretion. Speak, then: have you come to trade, to bargain, or to serve?”

Option.text: Who are the Council of Five Houses?
Do you know anything about Minax’s agents?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Darius smiles thinly.

“Sunreach is a city of opportunity—for those who recognize its tides. Our harbor is the largest in the southern lands; goods, rumors, and gold flow here from every continent. But beware: fortunes can turn as quickly as the wind, and loyalty is bought and sold as easily as silk.”

Option.text: And your Council rules this city?
I am seeking work, not a lecture.
I’ll keep that in mind. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He adjusts his sash, almost proudly.

“The Council of Five Houses—trade dynasties old and new. We keep the peace, set tariffs, and—some say—decide the fate of the entire coast.
Of course, beneath the velvet and gold there is always a dagger or two. Only a fool trusts appearances in Sunreach.”

Option.text: You sound like a man with many enemies.
Enough politics. Do you have work?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Five Houses, five ambitions. The House of Ashveil rules the sea lanes, the House of Veynar—mine—handles land trade and silks. Then there are the desert-born, the coiners, and the arms dealers.
Alliances shift, rivalries simmer, and profit always finds a way. But enough of that—unless you’d like to join our little game?”

Option.text: I am ready for your game. What do you need done?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Darius lowers his voice.

“In times past, we’d laugh at rumors of shadow cults. Now? I see Minax’s hand everywhere—spies, saboteurs, and fools who think her chaos brings profit. But Sunreach is not so easily broken.
If you hear whispers of the ‘Blood Cult’ in our undercity… take care whom you trust. Even the Council’s not immune to corruption.”

Option.text: What do you want done about these cultists?
Do you suspect anyone in the Council?
I prefer not to get involved in cult business.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Information is my preferred currency. If you uncover names, symbols, or shipments tied to Minax, bring them to me—discreetly. Payment will not be an issue.
For now, I have a more immediate task.”

“A wise question. Some say Seraphine Ashveil’s ships fly black sails after midnight; others whisper of Magistrate Thornwall’s debts. Even I, it’s rumored, have my own secrets.
Best not to believe everything you hear, but if you uncover the truth—come to me first.”

Option.text: I’ll steer clear of Council politics.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Then move along. Sunreach has little patience for idle wanderers. But should you desire gold or secrets, return to me.”

Option.text: On second thought, do you have work?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Darius steeples his fingers, voice lowering.

“There is a shipment of enchanted Qasarian silk—worth a king’s ransom—due to arrive at midnight. My rivals would see it ‘misplaced’ en route. I need someone neither House nor pirate to ensure the goods reach my warehouse, unmolested.

Deliver this Sealed Ledger to my contact at the Docks—do not let it fall into the wrong hands. Pirates, cultists, even the city guard may try to interfere.
Do this well, and the coffers of House Veynar will remember your name. Are you prepared to take this risk?”

Option.text: I accept. Give me the Sealed Ledger.
Why not use your own men?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Darius hands you a wax-sealed ledger, heavy with concealed runes.

“Guard it with your life. If intercepted, the silk—and my favor—are lost. Deliver it to a woman named Mara at the central docks. She wears a violet cloak.
Return here for your reward once the deed is done. And remember: Sunreach does not forget its friends—or its enemies.”

Option.text: It will be done, Merchant Prince.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Pirates under Lady Seraphine’s flag may try to seize the ledger. Some city guards are in her pocket, and rumor has it a Minax cultist seeks to sabotage trade tonight.
Trust only those you know—or those who cannot afford betrayal.”

He grins, teeth sharp.

“My men are known. Yours is a face the city will not expect. If you succeed, perhaps that will change.
In Sunreach, anonymity is a valuable coin. Spend it wisely.”

Option.text: That makes sense. I’ll do it.
I value my anonymity too much to risk it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Darius leans back slightly, studying you with a measured gaze.

“Curious, are you? Most only care about coin. But very well… I was not born into power. I earned it—through wit, risk, and an unwavering refusal to play by anyone else’s rules.
I built my House from a caravan, a rusted blade, and debts owed by the right people. Now I trade in silk, secrets, and silence.”

Option.text: How did you rise to lead a House?
What do you want for Sunreach?
Who do you trust in the Council?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I began as a caravan broker between Britannia and the Tokuno archipelago. Pirates stole my first cargo. Bandits raided the second. I learned to hire swords, forge permits, and bribe port masters.

By my fifth year, I owned three ships, two warehouses, and enough blackmail material to start a House. Now… I don’t lose shipments. I lose patience.”

“Sunreach stands between dying empires and rising shadows. With Lord British gone, and Minax in motion, we must choose: cling to old crowns, or build something new.

I would see Sunreach become a sovereign power—answering to no kingdom, beholden to no mage tower. Trade is eternal. Empires are not.”

Darius smirks.

“Trust is a liability. Still... I respect Hassan Al-Kadir. His honor gets in the way of profit, but he holds this city’s soul better than the rest. As for Lady Seraphine…”
He pauses. “Let’s just say she’s a useful storm. Until she turns.”

Option.action: SendMessage:Best watch your step. She likes her guests bold—or expendable.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Darius waves a hand dismissively.

“Thornwall? He’s as malleable as wet parchment. Seraphine owns half his soul. The Blood Cult might own the rest. I keep him close for now… like one might keep a spoiled fruit until the right guest arrives.”

Option.action: SendMessage:Dangerous talk... but I like your fire.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Power breeds enemies. Hassan opposes corruption. Seraphine wants chaos she can profit from. Aerilon's mages scorn us as ‘grounded opportunists.’
I call that envy. Let them scoff while I control the docks, the coin, and the secrets.”

Option.text: What would you do about Seraphine?

Option.action: SendMessage:Useful. I may call on you when the moon is dark.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I use her ships. She uses my trade lanes. It’s a game—until someone missteps. Should her pirates take liberties with my silk again, I’ll turn the city guard loose with full sanction. Or perhaps… someone quieter.”

He glances at you.

Option.text: You’re looking at someone quieter now.
That’s not my kind of job.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Darius narrows his eyes appraisingly.

“Ambition... I see it in you. Most lack the nerve to ask. Perhaps you’ll go far.”

He tosses you a small token.
